main event: On 3-24-1955 in Falls Church, Virginia, three bright orange objects in wedge formation, with the object in the middle being the largest, were observed moving southwest, hovering, accelerating, and then disappearing in three seconds without making any sound. The objects were later described to resemble stars with no aerodynamic features or exhaust noticed.
interesting points: The objects were observed in a wedge formation, accelerating and disappearing within a very short span of time, indicating high speed and maneuverability.
No sound was reported despite the close observation of the objects, which is unusual for conventional aircraft.
The objects were initially reported to be one to three thousand feet above ground level, later changed to ten thousand feet due to the angle of observation.
The sighting was reported by commercial airline personnel, adding credibility to the observation.
The objects approached a commercial airliner at a rapid rate before turning towards Washington and disappearing, indicating a potential interaction with other air traffic.
sighted object: Three bright orange objects in wedge formation
photographs: No photographs included in the report
